primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades a world held by the powers of Sin and Death to rescue a humanity that is incapable of saving itself from judgment.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Judge who is to come has given himself to be judged in our place
He will come and save you
The Son of God has borne it all himself

object.identificatie: Salvation/Rescue from the 'present evil age' and the 'power of Satan'
tekstueel_bewijs: to save us all from Satan’s power
the action of grace in territory held largely by the devil

zender.identificatie: The Divine Purpose / The Triune God
tekstueel_bewijs: called into being by the divine purpose
the poor have the good news proclaimed to them

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Prophets / The Martyrs
tekstueel_bewijs: John’s preaching sets it in motion
called into being... to declare the apocalyptic arrival
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, Christ is the Mediator/Helper in his suffering.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through the Word and the 'divine raid'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Satan / The Powers and Principalities / The Violent World
tekstueel_bewijs: territory held largely by the devil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but an 'evil age' and 'Satan's power' which humans cannot resist on their own.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to the arriving Kingdom.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Standing for truth / Resisting the 'push' of the age
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'pushing back' is only possible because of the 'divine raid' (Grace) that precedes it.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist → God/Messiah ← Satan/Violent Rulers
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Suffering Judge → Bearing the Judgment

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Son of God has borne it all himself
The Messiah has come to place himself squarely on the side of those without status
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We don’t want all our desires to be known
We are likely to fear and hate
You have to push as hard as the age

voorbeelden: We don’t want to get caught
We are not strong enough or virtuous enough... to resist our demons
We cannot resist unless there is some sort of divine raid

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human LACK of power (non-pouvoir) and God's sovereign power to act on our behalf.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the fear of S2 (Judgment) through the falsity of ~S1 (Sentimentalism) to the resolution where S1 (Grace) absorbs S2 (Judgment).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary: The Judge (S1) takes the Vengeance (S2) upon Himself.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; judgment is described as an inescapable cosmic reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies a 'Heavy Opponent' (Satan/Death) and a 'Helpless Subject' (Man), necessitating a 'Subject-Switch' to Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Statues of martyrs who suffered violence.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Judge who is to come has given himself to be judged in our place.
We are not strong enough... to resist our demons.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: While martyrs are mentioned, they are presented as those who 'suffered violence' rather than heroes to be imitated by human will.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: They are witnesses to the Kingdom's arrival, not models of self-improvement.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; moving from fear of exposure to peace through substitution.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of judgment and the narrative of the cross are perfectly integrated.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Judge' and the 'Suffering Servant'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Judge... has given himself to be judged in our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Christological 'raid' than the internal work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a territory held by the devil.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject and humanity as the Receiver of a rescue operation.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic 'Grace' structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' and 'moralism' by making the cross the location where the actants of Judge and Judged meet.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of political imagery (Ken Starr), semiotics reveals that these are merely 'actors' filling the actantial role of 'Opponent' or 'Judge'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Greek of Matthew 11; semiotics focuses on the 'Subject-Object' movement of the Kingdom's violence.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that the 'Judge' and the 'Victim' are the same Actant (God), which is the semiotic definition of the Atonement.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Heavy Opponent' to validate the necessity of a 'Divine Subject'.
